title: The New Book “The Impartiality of God” by David C. Green Sheds Light on Divine Justice and Fairness in Biblical Interpretation | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Apr 18, 2024 - Renowned author David C. Green will soon be releasing a groundbreaking book, “ The Impartiality of God ,” which delves into the profound theological concept of divine impartiality within the context of the Bible. This thought-provoking work offers fresh perspectives on God’s character and justice, challenging traditional interpretations and shedding light on the significance of historical context and grammatico-historical exegesis.
“The Impartiality of God” is a comprehensive exploration of the divine attribute of impartiality. David C. Green takes readers on a journey through the Bible, examining passages that emphasize God’s objectivity and fairness. Through meticulous exegesis, he uncovers the deeper meanings of these texts, offering a deeper understanding of the theological implications they hold.
One of the central themes of the book is the theological significance of Job’s ordeal. Green uses Job's ordeal to introduce the importance of understanding God's impartiality, highlighting the role of divine justice and impartiality in the face of adversity. The author does not exaggerate or change the information that has been provided by Job.
“The Impartiality of God” places a strong emphasis on the use of grammatico-historical exegesis (GHE) as a method for interpreting biblical texts. Green explains how this approach, which considers the cultural and historical context of the text, can lead to a more accurate understanding of God’s character and intentions as presented in the Bible.
The book also addresses common misconceptions and misinterpretations of God’s impartiality found in biblical texts. By providing clarity on these matters, Green seeks to deepen readers’ appreciation of God’s moral consistency.
David C. Green’s “The Impartiality of God” is a thought-provoking contribution to theological scholarship. It challenges prevailing interpretations and encourages readers to think critically about the concept of divine justice and fairness in the Bible.
About The Author
David C. Green is the senior pastor of Living Faith Bible Church, Sauquoit, NY, where he has served for the past 25 years. He and his wife, Maria, have four children: Elizabeth, Gabriel, Carys, and Adrianna. David received a three-year diploma in Bible and Missions from Davis College, Pottersville, NY; a BS in church ministries from Liberty University; master’s degrees in both divinity and theology from Liberty Baptist Theological Seminary; and a Ph.D. in Biblical Studies from Capitol Seminary, Greenbelt, MD.
